medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until approximately 6 months earlier, when lethargy and epigastric pain developed, associated with a dry throat, subjective fever, and frontal headache. The epigastric pain was rated at 7 out of 10 in severity and was relieved temporarily by acetaminophen. Symptoms progressed with intermittent intensification, flank and back pain, and associated weight loss of approximately 4.5 kg. Symptoms were not relieved by antacids or other medications.
medical_history.family_history: The father had high cholesterol, the maternal grandfather had coronary artery disease, the maternal grandmother had throat cancer, and other maternal relatives had type 1 diabetes mellitus and gallstones. Both paternal and maternal family members reportedly had alcoholism.
medical_history.social_history: The patient smoked one or two cigarettes weekly and reported no use of illicit drugs. He was a college student living with peers when not at his parents' home. He had a history of binge drinking and had recently quit smoking tobacco.
